page.title: 19LOCAL PAPER,BARNSTAPLE.
page.content: We interviewed the news editor of the {N.Devon Journal Herald}It is N.Devon's local paper and comes out every Thursday and costs 16p.The{Journal}was first published in about 1835.The old copies of the paper are stored away in the Athenaeum so they don't rot but now most are stored on micro film.The {Journal}used to sell about 33,000 copies per week but sales have fallen to 26,300 copies.The reason for the drop in readership is competition from two free papers:the{N.Devon Advertiser {and the Bideford Gazette.}Altogether the Journal has 9 reporters.The most common things that people write to the paper to complain about are the link road,noisy aircraft,dogs fouling the pavements and water rates.The reporters get stories from the police, firemen,life boat stations,and various local organisations such as W.I.'s.
